div1.ab: Demand of information on the subjet of a project of American colonization on the West Coast of Africa.
The Minister to Mr. Commander of the naval division of the West Coast of Africa.
div1.p: Mr. Commander, by your letter on the date of last Nov 12th, + you only informed that in execution of the instructions contained in my dispatch from the 21st of July 1853, you had given for mission to Mr. Captain Commander of the Brig the Messenger to take the information on the results of the exploration recently effected on the coast of Africa by Captain Lynch of John Adam's, of the American Navy.

You announce to me to have learned that this officer, after having returned to America, had waited for news on the coast of Africa where he would have been charged by his government with laying the foundations of a Trading Post, in one of the big rivers of the South, maybe Lagos. Niger or the old Calebar.

It seems certain to you that the state of unpleasant stagnation in which languishes the republic of Liberia et is the real cause that drives the government and the religious societies of America to search on this point for a new position.
I attach a lot of price to be kept apartement up to date on all that is relative to this project of American colonization.

Certain new facts of which the government has knowledge seem to indicate that the spirit of entreprise of the United States inclines today towards West Africa with a certain intensity. The interests that we have in the same vicinity are too considerable for us not to follow this movement with the more attention, thus I pray that you d'
div1.ab:
de une transmettre tous les faits et renseignement qui à cet égard parvenir votre connaisance.
R.C..D.
